Package Framework.Interfaces

Interface IWorld

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Core
    public interface IWorld
    IWorld implementations provide the virtual world functionality for the simulation. Note that the top-level simulation class must implement the simulation loop.
    Version:
    0.6
    Author:
    Marc Price

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addDisplayObject​(IDisplayObject displayable)
      METHOD: add a displayable to the world.
      void create()
      METHOD: create and initialise the 3D world.
      void destroy()
      METHOD: destroy the 3D world.
      void removeDisplayObject​(IDisplayObject displayable)
      METHOD: remove a displayable from the world.
      void update()
      Apply all updates to the environment.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        void create()
        METHOD: create and initialise the 3D world.

      • destroy

        void destroy()
        METHOD: destroy the 3D world. Although there is a garbage-collector in Java, the world has to be destroyed with 'destroy' in order to close-down your simulation-loop cleanly.

      • addDisplayObject

        void addDisplayObject​(IDisplayObject displayable)
               throws WorldDoesNotExistException
        METHOD: add a displayable to the world.
        Parameters:
        displayable - - a displayable of type IDisplayObject
        Throws:
        WorldDoesNotExistException

      • removeDisplayObject

        void removeDisplayObject​(IDisplayObject displayable)
                  throws WorldDoesNotExistException
        METHOD: remove a displayable from the world.
        Parameters:
        displayable - - the displayable of type IDisplayObject to be removed
        Throws:
        WorldDoesNotExistException

      • update

        void update()
     throws WorldDoesNotExistException
        Apply all updates to the environment. This must be called at the end of each pass through the simulation loop.
        Throws:
        WorldDoesNotExistException
